III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities;
Section seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Description (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1,
2022.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/3/23, youth was arguing with another youth at the facility.
Youth locked themselves in their room to calm down while staff
stayed outside the door to monitor. Staff were laughing and
criticizing youth outside of the door. Staff blocked the door to
prevent youth from leaving. Youth was later transported for a
mental health evaluation.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
02/15/2023.
I interviewed the complainant via phone on 02/16/2023. The
allegations were reviewed, and the complainant said they reported
allegations after reviewing Youth A’s mental health records.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via phone on
02/17/2023. Youth A has been at the facility for 3 months and has
been struggling due to her behavior and does not like to be told
what to do. She denied having any concerns regarding staff or the
facility. She said Youth A does have a history of self-harming and
the facility followed Youth A’s safety plan when Youth A
expressed wanting to hurt herself. Youth A is currently at
Havenwyck due to self-harming.
I interviewed Youth A at the hospital on 02/17/2023. Youth A
reported that she had been at the hospital for two weeks, because
she was having suicidal thoughts. Regarding the allegations, she
denied being locked in her room while at the facility. Youth A said
on the day in question she was upset about having to do chores
and got into an argument with another youth. She wanted to be
alone, so she locked herself in conference room, but the staff
unlocked the door and would not leave her alone in the
conference room. She denied staff was blocking the door, but said
she wanted staff to leave her alone in the conference room. She
admitted that she was have suicidal thoughts. Youth A refused to
answer any more questions and got up and left the room.
I interviewed the Director at the facility on 02/21/2023. The
Director reported on the day in question Youth A was upset and
locked herself in the conference room, so the Supervisor unlocked
the conference door. Youth A refused to leave the conference
room, so the supervisor pulled up a chair and sat in the doorway
to the conference, because Youth A kept locking the conference
room door. Youth A made suicidal statements, so EMS was
contacted, and Youth A was transported to the hospital. Director
2

pulled up the video footage of the incident and provided a copy of
the incident report.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 02/21/2023. Supervisor 1reported
on the day in question Youth A was upset about having to do
chores and got angry when another resident moved her book and
so she went to the conference room and locked the door.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 followed her and unlocked the
conference room door. Youth A closed the door and locked it
again. Supervisor 1 pulled up a chair and sat in the doorway of the
conference room, so Youth A cannot lock herself in the room.
Supervisor 1 denied staff criticizing or laughing at the youth. She
said while Youth A was in the conference room she was playing
with the light switch and made comments about wanting to kill
herself, so law enforcement and EMS were contacted. Youth A
was transported to the hospital without any other incident.
I interviewed Staff 1, at the facility on02/21/2023. Staff 1 reported
that she has been working at the facility for one year and four
months. She has completed all her training including CPI. Staff 1
said Youth A was upset about having to do chores and was being
verbally aggressive with the other resident. When she attempted
to redirect Youth A about her behavior, Youth A got mad and went
to the conference room and locked the door. She told the
supervisor, and the supervisor unlocked the door, but Youth A
locked it again. The supervisor pulled a chair over and sat in the
doorway, so that Youth A would not lock herself in the conference
room. She denied any staff member criticizing or laughing at
Youth A. She said Youth A was upset because they would not let
lock herself in the conference room.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 02/21/2023. Youth B has
been at the facility for one year. Youth B recalled the incident
involving Youth A and reported she witnessed Youth A go to the
conference room and lock the door. She said the supervisor had
to keep opening the conference room door, because Youth A kept
locking the door. She denied ever being locked in her room or any
other room at the facility. She further denied witnessing Staff 1 or
Supervisor criticizing or laughing at Youth A during the incident.
Youth B expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I spoke with Youth A’s Therapist via telephone on 03/23/2023.
Therapist reported she meets weekly with Youth A for individual
sessions and Youth A has never reported any concerns regarding
staff or the facility. She said Youth A was hospitalized for two
weeks at Havenwyck due to making statements about wanting to
3

harm herself. She has met with Youth A several times since being
discharged from the hospital and Youth A has never expressed
any concern regarding the facility.
Video Reviewed:
I reviewed video footage at the facility on 02/21/2023. The video
date is 02/02/2023 at 7:30 pm in the hallway leading to the
conference room. Youth A is seen going to the conference room
and closing the door. Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 walk up to the door
and unlock it. Youth A closes the door again, Supervisor 1 unlocks
the door. Supervisor 1 pulls up a chair and sits in the doorway to
the conference room. Video has no audio and there is no camera
in the conference room.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation:
• Incident Report, 02/02/2023, authored by Supervisor 1.
Report was consistent with Supervisor 1’s interview.
• Staff 1’s employee file; No disciplinary action reports.
• Reviewed facility’s Health Services policy: Suicide
Precautions- Staff is to always have youth in their line of
sight.
• Youth A’s safety plan to address suicidal ideations or self-
harming behavior. Remove any items that can be used to
self-harm, sit with Youth A, engage with youth to talk about
her feelings, encourage youth to participate in activities
(coloring, painting, reading), give youth space but don’t
leave her unsupervised, give youth her stress ball.
• PA 116, 722.112b Definitions: scope
(1) As used in this section and sections 2c,2d,and 2e,
unless the context requires otherwise:
(j) “Seclusion” means the involuntary placement of a minor
child in a room alone, where the minor child is prevented
from exiting by any means, including the physical presence
of a staff person if the sole purpose of that staff person’s
presence is to prevent the minor child from exiting the
room. Seclusion does not include the use of a sleeping
room during regular sleeping hours to ensure security
precautions appropriate to the condition and circumstances
of a minor child placed in the child caring institution as a
result of an order of the family division of circuit court under
section 2(a) and (b) of chapter XIIA of the probate code of
1939, 1939 PA 288, MCL 712A.2, if the minor child’s
individual case treatment plan indicates that the security
precautions would be in the minor child’s best interest.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as video evidence, staff and
youth's interviews, support that Youth A was not locked in her
4

room or the conference room. Youth A locked herself in the
conference room and made statements about wanting to harm
herself. Staff responded appropriately to Youth A making
statements about wanting to harm herself, by supervising and
contacting emergency services.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
